page.title: 05ROSEWARNE E.H.S.
page.content: Rosewarne Experimental Horticulture Station is part of the Agricultural Development and Advisory Service of the Ministry of Agriculture,Fisheries and food and specialises in research appropriate to South-Western England.Much of the work at Rosewarne is concerned with the staple crops of this area particularly winter cauliflower. Varieties have been interbred to produce early crops and many experiments have been done to find out the best growing conditions for the vegetable. At present there is an experiment in pollination and cross pollination using bees and flies in plastic containers.Another crop which is given great attention at Rosewarne is the tomato. They are experimenting with various methods of growing tomatoes including rockwall,and methods of fertilisation.
